### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE robots (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   name VARCHAR(50),
   model VARCHAR(50),
   energy_level DECIMAL(10,2),
   creation_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
   robot_id INT,
   timestamp TIMESTAMP,
   energy_used DECIMAL(10,2),
   PRIMARY KEY (robot_id, timestamp),
   FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES robots(id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE robots SET energy_level = 80.50 WHERE id = 1;

);

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE robots (
   id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   name VARCHAR(50),
   model VARCHAR(50),
   energy_level DECIMAL(10,2),
   creation_date DATE
);


CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
   robot_id INT,
   timestamp TIMESTAMP,
   energy_used DECIMAL(10,2),
   PRIMARY KEY (robot_id, timestamp),
   FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES robots(id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE energy_consumption SET energy_used = energy_used + 1 WHERE robot_id = 2 AND timestamp = '2022-01-15 10:30:00';

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE Robots (
    robot_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    energy_consumption DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    energy_usage DECIMAL,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robots(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE RobotStatus (
    status_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    status TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robots(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE MaintenanceLogs (
    maintenance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    maintenance_type TEXT,
    details TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robots(robot_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Locations (
    location_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    robot_id INT,
    latitude DECIMAL,
    longitude DECIMAL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (robot_id) REFERENCES Robots(robot_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE Robots SET energy_consumption = 10.5 WHERE robot_id = 1;
